how much effort it takes to do the thing that you need to do now in work design
Theory they Define three different types of cognitive load there is intrinsic
cognitive load which is actually doing the task extrinsic which is retrieving information and and the format that that
information comes in and how understandable it is and then there's Germain load which is processing that information organizing it into schemas
in your brain so that you can use that information to perform the tasks and how difficult that is so for example to put
it in concrete terms because we're all developers um imagine you have have a online shopping site and you've been
asked to add a suggested purchases section so you know you bought these things you know how about you buy these
ones as well so that's your task right intrinsic load is the actual difficulty of writing that code you know typing the
keystrokes opening the files finding like getting the right right files open and making the changes to the code there
is inherent difficulty in some of that right extrinsic load is about getting
the right information and that can include include things like having a look through the code base to find out if there's any code that we can use that
already has suggested items based on other ones and if not how do we get the data out of the database to to find that
information right where does that live even things like how easily can I find the files that I need to edit that are
related to this change all of that is extrinsic load how difficult it is to find that information and how it's
presented to you and then once you have that information Germain load is the
processing all of it so that you can actually perform the task keeping it in your head in a in a known format so how
do I internalize where all the code is that I need to change and how it fits together along with the solution that
